title: Set site-wide page background to white (disable dark background)

requirements.text: Ensure all site pages render with a white (light) background instead of a black (dark) background, regardless of the userâ€™s OS/system theme settings.

quotes: The background of the site pages should be white not black

acceptanceCriteria: When visiting any route (e.g., /, /customer-faq, /privacy-policy), the page background is light/white and not dark/black.
On devices with system dark mode enabled, the app still renders with a light/white background by default.
No UI areas that use the global background token (e.g., Layout container and header using bg-background) appear black due to dark theme being applied automatically.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any code in frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Keep the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture unchanged.
nonGoals: Performing a full codebase review for bugs, glitches, misspellings, or general QA beyond the background color issue.
Adding a user-facing theme toggle or dark-mode support features (unless required to keep the background white).
